mapper.sql:
select t.id, t.username, t.password, t.name, t.avatar, t.email, t.phone,
from k_user t
mapper.insert: insert into k_user ( id, username, password, name, avatar, email, phone, sort_index, create_user_id, create_user_name, create_time ) values ( #{id}, #{username}, #{password}, #{name}, #{avatar}, #{email}, #{phone}, #{sortIndex}, #{createUser.id}, #{createUser.name}, #{createTime} );
mapper.update: update k_user set id = #{id}, username = #{username}, password = #{password}, name = #{name}, avatar = #{avatar}, email = #{email}, phone = #{phone}, sort_index = #{sortIndex}, last_modify_user_id = #{lastModifyUser.id}, last_modify_user_name = #{lastModifyUser.name}, last_modify_time = #{lastModifyTime} where id = #{id};
mapper.select: select t.id, t.username, t.password, t.name, t.avatar, t.email, t.phone, , r.id as "role.id", r.code as "role.code", r.name as "role.name", p.id as "permission.id", p.code as "permission.code" from k_user t left join k_user_role ur on ur.user_id = t.id left join k_role r on r.id = ur.role_id left join k_role_permission rp on r.id = rp.role_id left join k_permission p on p.id = rp.permission_id where t.is_delete=0 and t.username=#{username,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
